author: sky.cactus
content: <@574864862338088960> As <@543900561460822016> indicated, the signature for type 0 transactions doesn't include the transaction type for backward compatibility reasons.  While only 2718 transactions will be valid in blocks and over devp2p after fork block, JSON-RPC and signing tools don't have to immediately update since the signature is the same as legacy transactions.

author: sky.cactus
content: Clients *will* have to do a one-time reformatting of all transactions in the pending pool on fork block, hopefully that is something that is quick enough that it can be done in under 15 seconds (I don't see why it wouldn't be).

author: abdel.stark
content: <@!301186049323958275> Thanks for the clarification. Indeed it seems reasonable to do this one time reformatting in under 15 seconds.
